alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 10:56AM MDT until further notice by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton continues a Flood Advisory for the following river in Wyoming... Salt River near Etna affecting Lincoln County. .Mountain snowmelt continues as cooler weather arrives to end the week. While this slows the snowmelt, rain showers are expected into the weekend. Overall, river levels will show little change through the weekend. For the Salt River Basin...including Etna...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt. * WHERE...Salt River near Etna. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 5.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Monitor high water along Swift Creek in northeastern and northern sections of Afton. Small creeks and streams are flooding in the towns of Freedom and Fairview. Minor flooding of ranchland/pastureland near Etna. At 5.5 feet, Flood stage. Low land flooding along Swift Creek in northeastern and northern sections of Afton. Low land flooding becomes more widespread upstream in the towns of Freedom and Fairview. Minor flooding of pastureland/ranchland. At 6.0 feet, Extensive low land flooding in northeastern and northern sections of Afton. Extensive low land flooding upstream in the towns of Freedom and Fairview. Minor flooding of farm/ranch houses upstream and downstream of gage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM MDT Thursday, June 1, the stage was 4.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain between 5.0 and 5.4 feet into the weekend. - Action stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. &&
info.instruction: Stay away from riverbanks, which may be eroded by the fast-moving water and could easily collapse. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
